DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Immunoglobulin Variable Region Family Collection Performed Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A free text field to specify information related to the family of the immunoglobulin variable region, the portion of an antibody molecule that contains the three hypervariable regions in both the heavy and light chains. It is comprised of the amino terminal half of the light chains and at most a third of the heavy chains from the amino termini.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Immunoglobulin Variable Region Family Collection Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the family of the immunoglobulin variable region, the portion of an antibody molecule that contains the three hypervariable regions in both the heavy and light chains. It is comprised of the amino terminal half of the light chains and at most a third of the heavy chains from the amino termini.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
